intro: Chaerophyllum canadense, commonly known as Canadian cow parsley, is a herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
